website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive food processor that's perfect for households that want a compact machine for occasional use.
pros: Shred and slice blade disc and S-blade included
Durable machine that holds up well over time
cons: There is only one speed setting
The feeder tube is small, so you must cut your food up before putting it in

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good
customer_reviews.text: I havent used it much, but wanted to write a review based on the majority of negative reviews ive read. Alot of people are complaining that the unit burnt out after trying to crush frozen fruit or make cookie dough. It is important to note that on the first page of the manual it specifically says not to do this, along with some other things to avoid. Its unfortunate this product is receiving negative reviews for reasons it simply wasnt designed to do. So far ive used it to make kimchi marinade, worked great!
customer_reviews.author: sylvester

customer_reviews.title: The control knob is worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this works great as a food processor, the problem is making it work. It has a weird little knob on the TOP of the back of the machine that requires you to grip it with your fingers and/or palm. It was extremely difficult to control, because, and yes, I will admit this, I'm over 60 years. My hands do not work as good as they used to and I found the process to be painful and uncomfortable. There were no grip points, like a raised knob to control it. So much for a fashionable change in an old product. Give me a button to push!
customer_reviews.author: DebT

customer_reviews.title: Great design for locking and unlocking the bowl
customer_reviews.text: This is the best food processor design. I've had one for the last 10 years and it was still working, but I dropped the bowl and it cracked so I decided to buy a new one. I couldn't find it at first and then it started showing up everywhere again! It's cone-shape makes it soooo easy and comfortable to hold on to lock and unlock the bowl and to operate right from the top instead of searching for buttons below (for us arthritis sufferers especially). The whole unit is more compact, lightweight, and easier to find a storage space for! It performs very well and I use it all the time. It makes life in the kitchen so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Takes abuse well
customer_reviews.text: As a backup processor this is perfect. It works just like my big cuisinart, only smaller. It's a pain to clean like all the other processors (so I make my kid clean it), and yes...it will even shut itself off if I forget that I shouldn't open the lid while its running. It's a decent little food processor, nothing more. I've abused this thing for months, forgotten to clean it out for a day (or two), etc etc, and it's still odor and damage-free. I even use it to prep fermented hot sauces with all sorts of acids and chilies and the poor little appliance suffers from no staining. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Copperrein

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little food processor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little food processor. Super easy to use, even I figured it out. I haven't tried the grater or shredder piece yet. My only advice would be to not try and process anything less than a cup - I tried to make pesto in it but the blade didn't go all the way down. There just wasn't enough food in there for it to process. You really can't be this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Overall

customer_reviews.title: Freaking Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wow - this thing is amazing. I always wanted a food processor, but just assumed they were too expensive. Then I ran into a few on Amazon that were affordable. This one had such good reviews that I had to try it. I just love this item. I have used all the functions on it, and everything has exceeded my expectations. I chop nuts, shred lettuce, slice veggies... you name it. It is really easy to clean as well. The pieces pull off very easily and wipe clean without any hard to reach places. This is one of my best buys on Amazon (and I've had a lot of buys).
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor I’ve had!  Better than my Ninja!
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me soooo much time!!! It is easy to assemble, a pleasure to use, the blade is awesome, large components make it easy to clean (there is no chance of food particles getting stuck in hard to reach places), and it’s just simply beautiful and user friendly. We make large batches of riced cauliflower for cauliflower pizza crusts. It used to take hours because my other food processor and my other blender were very temperamental and difficult to line up ( we all know if everything doesn’t line up our appliances won’t work and I hated having to play repair woman)... Love, love, love this food processor and I use it all of the time!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer r.

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis?  You might not want to buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Like the shortness of this food processor. It allows you to store it where others can't go because they're taller. If you have arthritis in your hands you may want to rethink purchasing this blender. It does not have buttons to press. It has a round knob at the top, it reminds me of half of a lemon, that you simply turn left or right but my arthritic hands find very hard to maneuver. I would not buy it again because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Norman-McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage. tried for first time, motor dead.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a chance house this thing. Unwrapped, cleaned everything. Set up a whole recipe for first attempt at falafel, so took me forever. Plugged it in and nothing. Checked power to outlet, good. Checked to make sure everything is lined perfectly, yup. Tried with canister off, dead. You'd think there would be some quality control to test these things before packaging. Guess not. Awful waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: pool man

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little loud
customer_reviews.text: I love my new food processor! Today I used it to make peanut butter banana muffins for breakfast, vegan mac n' cheese at lunch, and walnut veggie burgers at dinner. It's a good size for smaller or medium recipes. It's a little loud though. Definitely will not use it while anyone is asleep. The feeding chute isn't very wide so most things will have to be cut to fit. No slicing whole tomatoes for burgers or large cucumbers for salads. Overall though I love it and am happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked there to be a THIN vs THICK shred/slice
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to purchase this after reading so many reviews. Sadly, it absolutely did not meet my expectations and I returned it. What bothered me most was: 1. there are only 2 blade options, shred or slice. I would have liked there to be a THIN vs THICK shred/slice, as the one option this machine priovides isnt good for everything. 2. lots of pieces stuck at top of blades. PROS: lightweight, small. easy to clean, easy to operate, simple, cheap. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: FaigieG

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: Would not work the first time I tried to use it. This was after the no return date so I am stuck with an appliance I did not get to use one time. I would have given it 0 stars if that had been an option. I also think it is a RIP OFF you can't return a new first time used item after 4 weeks. I will never buy anything electronic from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron A

customer_reviews.title: It does and it's been great ever since
customer_reviews.text: Man does this thing chop up food fast and well. I accidentally, when I first bought this, plugged it in while it was turned on with the little food pusher inside and it chopped it up and broke off a few pieces of plastic. That was a bonehead move on my part, but I didn't want to return it just yet because I wanted to see if it still worked. It does and it's been great ever since. I totally recommend it, but please if you buy this, make sure everything is off and nothing is in the food processor that you don't want to process when you first plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Lee

customer_reviews.title: broke first use
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my daughter and it literally broke the first time she used it shredding motzarella cheese. I also bought it because it seemed to be slightly smaller. My daughter said, though, that it's footprint (space on counter or shelf) was more than a regular food processor. I have a hamilton beach food processor that I've had for years and it works great, but obviously this one did not work out at all
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Great model. Had an old version of this for many years. I sold it before moving across the country and just had to replace it. This works just like my old one and I love it. Strong, sturdy, easy to clean and big enough to hold plenty of stuff :)
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my small kitchen. I wanted something to do some basic food processor functions.. this is it. Pretty easy to clean. If you need a super heavy duty processor for constant use -- this might not be for you. But for my occasional use to slice veggies or cheese .. its perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this it quit within seconds of shredding cheese. After we figured out a wire was loose inside the thing it worked fine for a short while. It quit again and its not worth my time to fix again. I had another one that was the same brand for over 35 years before I bought this. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S Harman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted. It is way better than the small devices yet smaller than a large food processor. I love. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy  Cloutier

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This food processor works great for chopping foods. Due to the clear acrylic bowl, you can view your food being chopped and choose when to stop the chopping process. This is a tough little machine that will handle all of your chopping needs for food preparation.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach 8 cup food processor
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one, I have had them through the years and absolutely love everything about it. It is durable, versatile and can make pastry, dough, salsa, coleslaw, and many other things. I love this food processor. It is my go to workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: MFrancis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like the side style, as opposed to the vertically oriented ones as it can fit under cabinets easily. Slices and shreds nicely. Shred does make pretty small pieces. Not super loud. Easy to clean. Make sure to cover the tube/put the pusher in or things can get a bit messy, but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Freyja Hadji

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a few months making sherbet.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 4 months mostly for frozen fruit and it broke already. Sounds like something stripped inside. The motor is going but the blade doesn't spin. Wouldn't have happened if I was just making salsa or sauce all the time which it worked great for. Just not good for frozen stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for hummus, 'single-ingredient ice cream', & smaller quantity liquids. Haven't used the slicing or grating blades much, but I'm quite pleased. Can be a little difficult to clean in all the nooks of the lid.
customer_reviews.author: j.h.

customer_reviews.title: Great to grind your own hamburger!
customer_reviews.text: Very good food processor for the money. I have always ground my own meat for hamburger for years, using my big meat grinder. I have just recently found out that I can grind my sirloin steak/roasts with my food processor and it works GREAT and is very easy to clean up compared to the big grinder. If you want to know how to do this, let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Barnie

customer_reviews.title: Quick Clean Up and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as warehouse deal. Although the box was damaged, the product inside was in perfect condition. I used this heavily for holiday cooking and it held up well and was easy to use and clean. I would recommend this item and purchasing from the Amazon warehouse. The value and quality of the product is unmatched. I will remember to look at items by price in the future when I place my orders to see if there are value priced alternatives to be had.
customer_reviews.author: anpublic

customer_reviews.title: My favorite food processor.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size. Not too big and bigger than the little one. Perfect. This is the second one of this brand. Great. Had the first one for years. Tried a different brand but nothing is as nice as this one. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: By far great! Just know that the feed tube is ~ 2.25 * 1.5 in. (5.7 * 3.8 Cm), you need to cut most veg. into smaller parts.
customer_reviews.author: Neda

customer_reviews.title: This machine works better than expensive machines
customer_reviews.text: This little gem performs better than my expensive food processor. I use it every other day, alternating with my expensive food processor. The Hamilton Beach actually does so much better than the other machine. It’s not as thick or heavy, but who cares? It works great. If it ever broke, I would sure buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Janice R.

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use than my Cuisinart food processer
customer_reviews.text: This works great, and is much easier to use than my Cuisinart food processer, which has a very fiddly locking bowl and lid. I have two negatives to report, though. The plastic bowl and lid turned cloudy in my dishwasher after the first use, and the knob is hard to use with damp hands. Overall, though, I think it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Better Than A Bass-o-matic
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. Easy to rinse and put away. No frills, no fuss, no sweat. I rice cauliflower, chop grate or mince vegetables and I suppose it could even handle a bass.
customer_reviews.author: azamazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality for Bottom Dollar
customer_reviews.text: This is our first food processor, and I was guided by another review here that said something like, "I bought this thinking if I used it enough I'd buy a good one, and I've had it for years now." Like that reviewer, we like this processor very much. I'm sure others have features this one doesn't, but this one seems well-made and plenty sturdy for the uses we are likely to make of it. I'm confident it will satisfy our needs for a long time. I'd recommend this model without hesitation, for anyone who wants a good food processor with what is probably a fairly basic feature set.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey O. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Just like the other one I owned
customer_reviews.text: I broke that one by grating mozarella, a huge no-no that I didn't know about. I had nearly broken it before but was able to get it apart, the last time I was not so lucky. For the price it can't be beat. Although I wish I had been able to reorder replacement pieces, i.e. the ones I broke, for less than it cost to buy it new. The motor worked fine in my old one that had been my husbands from before we met, 5 years? I've diced, sliced, and shredded veggies, grated cheese, sliced pepperoni, made pie crust, ground nuts, made flour, and it is possible to not puree everything (unlike with the magic bullet).
customer_reviews.author: food pixie

customer_reviews.title: Love it. A go-to item in my kitchen now
customer_reviews.text: Love it. A go-to item in my kitchen now. It would have been nice if there were some instructions about how to put the unit together so as to make it run the first time you use it. I, like several others who have commented, had trouble at first. (See my response to someone else's question about how to set it up properly.)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for purée ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I use it to purée fruit for a smoothie and vegetables for a casserole. It does a great job with that. I just wish it had a spout for pouring it out. It does not work well for slicing small amounts of vetables for a salad.
customer_reviews.author: judith

customer_reviews.title: it seems a bit flimsy & the on-off-pulse knob is kind of hard to get good grip on
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and so far it work alright. But, it seems a bit flimsy & the on-off-pulse knob is kind of hard to get good grip on.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Fox

customer_reviews.title: Blades
customer_reviews.text: the blades do not turn after a few times of use, didn't work so well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Monireh

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have used this machine to shred cheese, mix dough, chop nuts, and chop ingredients for salsa. It works like a charm. The blade is extremely sharp so be careful when handling. It is on the noisy side when in use. You can't talk to someone else in the kitchen while it is running without shouting, in other words. The only con is that you cannot mix or chop small batches of ingredients. This is an 8 cup processor and cannot do efficient work of 1 or 2 cup jobs. Otherwise it is a tough machine that can take some abuse and still do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Works great but broke very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Piece broke very quickly. It still works but I don’t know for how much longer. It is too difficult to twist the food container into place so it will operate. I think it broke because of twisting too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, easy to use and chops in seconds. I think the chopping attachment works better than the shredding and slicing attachment.
customer_reviews.author: gnk

customer_reviews.title: Not 8 cups
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an old Black and Decker 4 cup that had recently broke. I thought I would upgrade to an 8 cup. When I took it out of the box the bowl didn't look much bigger than my old one so I filled a measuring cup with water and it came at about 6 cups when filled to the very top which of course you can't do when you're actually using it. Also the picture on the box showed measurement marks that we're not on the bowl. The only mark was max liquid mark which was at about 2 cups. Sending it back today.
customer_reviews.author: W. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Basically OK but some poorly designed features
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect anything much at this price and got an appliance that is just that.....OK for light infrequent basic jobs. The on/off knob, as others have mentioned, is tricky to use unless it and your hands are completely dry. Slightly hazardous is the fact that there is only a very small piece of plastic (also slippery when wet) to hold onto in order to remove the slicing blade. Resorting to trying to get it off by holding it by the edges or sliding a fingernail under the slicing section (I do it but won't recommend it) or turning it upside down are about the only ways to remove it. Care must be taken to unlatch the bowl for removal.
customer_reviews.author: Barb H.

customer_reviews.title: Plain Jane
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for over a month. I've used it 6-7 times with no problems. I've done cheese and various vegetables. It has a pulse and an 'on' setting. It's nothing fancy, all the parts can stay in and on the unit. No pieces to dig out of the drawer when it's time to use it. I leave it on the counter; it's fairly compact for an 8 cup processor. It looks sleek and not a boxy monster like its predecessor. It's a great deal for the $, if you're not planning to do heavy duty or fancy processing.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: Have had several food processors over the years. This is one I really don't like. I didn't think I needed the wide-mouth food chute, but this chute will only hold baby red potatoes, at best. I have to cut my potatoes into smaller pieces to feed through the chute. The slicing blade is already very very thin, so smaller vegetables are almost julienne cuts. I find the top difficult to remove. Wouldn't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this processor awhile back and it still runs like it's new. easy to use and I use it everyday. It doesn't take up much space and gets the job done, Unless you own a restaurant or have 12 kids this is really all you need. Sold my super expensive food processor, this one is more accessible and I use it more because of that. You name it I prepared it with this little workhorse. Save you're money buy this product, I also have bought other HamiltonBeach products and they're great, too. good company with great products at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: tommyv

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is my first food processor and it’s worked very well so far. I use it primarily to make my infant’s purées. Easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya L.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Update 6-21-2015 It's been over two years, and I'm just as in love with it. I'm not really sure if I can say enough good things about this. I had one for 7 years, and after much reading have decided to buy this one. It works just as good as the old one. Why waste money and time on a fancy one that's a bear to clean, a bear to operate? This is all you need. I just sliced pepperoni for pizza and shredded the cheese all in about 60 seconds. In the dishwasher it goes, zero hassle.
customer_reviews.author: G.I.JANE

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Ours lasted 4 years of infrequent and noisy use before the spindle stripped. Do not purchase this model 70450.
customer_reviews.author: QA4U

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap - plastic was broken and it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Corin Ocasio

customer_reviews.title: It was great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this food processor less than a year ago and it recently died. I've mostly used it for shredding cheese and for blending fresh fruits and herbs. I've never overloaded it or used it to blend anything hard like ice, but it now overheats when shredding cheese or trying to blend anything. I feel like an appliance should last longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Luvin Eli

customer_reviews.title: Dependable,. great price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. I had first one for almost 20 years. I use a lot eve to make a pasta. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jolanta Menert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for everyday use!
customer_reviews.text: I had been putting off getting a food processor for the longest time - didn't want a big item taking up limited counter space. Then I saw this on Amazon and thought at the sale price it was worth trying. I am so glad I did. What I like about it: 1)the 8-cup size is the perfect size for everyday use 2)easy to load 3) easy to clean and 4)it is compact enough to fit on the appliance cart with the bread machine and large pots and pans. I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Small Town Blues

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PUT IN THE DISHWASHER! Other than that works good. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LEZLIE OBERLIN

customer_reviews.title: This is a great food processor for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I received this food processor originally as a gift probably 7 or so years ago- about three weeks ago, the middle bracket (The one that makes the blades spin) cracked on me while grating some very soft cheese. Seeing as this product lasted me 7 or so years, it was worth it, so I purchased it again and kept the blades and bowl from my original processor. I like that it stores nicely and the bowl doesn't stain when doing things like tomatoes. Also, making a cheese ball or a pie crust is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great design  !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect low profile dezign. Large enough for any recipe in my kitchen! Powerful enough to chop, mince, and with the slicing attachment, very versatile!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this food processor often but when I do I can't believe what a great job it does. It's easy to put together, take apart, easy to clean and it really works. If you want to puree something, you'll get it done. I often use it to turn old bread crusts into bread crumbs and it takes it no time to make that happen! For a food processor, it's not unbearably noisy either. Excellent product for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: blakes68

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Simple Processor
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement HB Food Processor. I loved my previous processor. It served me well for over 10 years. Easy to use . Easy to clean. Stores well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Crawford

customer_reviews.title: OK for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the money but the blade attachments are not the greatest. Everything gets pushed to the outside of the bowl and you constantly have to stop, remove the top, and scrape contents back to the middle in order to finish your work. If you need it for just a few things (I am making my own baby food--so not a ton of use) probably worth the risk to buy it and see if this works before investing in a more expensive model. Good size for storage in my small kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: My new grater works great.
customer_reviews.text: At first it was really difficult to put the parts together and make them work. It took me a half a dozen tries before I realized that the notched area on the motor part was meant for something to slide in and lock. -- the edge of the cover, to be exact. Glad I finally figured it out -- and have been making fabulous carrot and raisin salads ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Lane

customer_reviews.title: good machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have always like Hamilton Beach food processors -- broke my old one, and no hesitation to buy another Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: macf

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So handy and easy to use and assemble. I will be more adventurous in my cooking now that I can incorporate recipes that call for a food processor.
customer_reviews.author: TC1723

customer_reviews.title: I am totally satisfied with my Hamilton Beach 70450 8-Cup Processor
customer_reviews.text: I had looked at a number of food processors, but they were so expensive and also too large to fit on my kitchen counter. When I checked the website for food processors and saw the Hamilton Beach 8-cup Food Processor and read the many positive customer reviews, I decided it was worth trying. Also, the price is so modest. My first experience was making piecrust, which had always been such a challenge. The results were perfect. Today I prepared a Mango/Avocado Guacamole. It was so easy to prepare. I am taking it to a church supper this evening. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Small, cheap brittle plastic bowl
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than it looks and seems made from flimsy plastic- it arrived shattered.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Meal Prep!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great food processor, especially for the price! We area family of 5 and I love to cook so this is perfect for us! It can fit 2 large onions cut into chunks, maybe even more. On Sundays I like to chop a ton of onions and peppers and things that I will need throughout the week for meals and have them ready in 1-cup portions, they freeze wonderfully and I always have them on hand, it is nice to not have to chop onions multiple times a week!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 Littles

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: for price great food processor, bole is cheep plastic but price is right
customer_reviews.author: Violetta C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product - Great price
customer_reviews.text: I chose this processor for its size and previous ratings and price. I have had expensive food processors and except for maybe shredding or slicing bit better, they don't stand up over time any better, and require counter top space which is at a premium in my house. This handy processor is smaller and can be tucked under the counter in a cabinet and it works just fine. Between this, my submersible blender, and my chefs knife, I am prepared for any kitchen task. I would have given this five stars, but I haven't had it long enough to say that yet. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Drifter

customer_reviews.title: Food processor review.
customer_reviews.text: Did not like it. Grinds food up too fine. Would like more than one pulse option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great job, great value
customer_reviews.text: Processes very quickly. The manual says not to run it for over 1 minute before letting it cool for a minute. I was skeptical about that. I have found that most things are done in under a minute anyway, unlike my past expensive processors. The base is easy to clean. I put the canister in the dishwasher. Sometimes, the lid is hard to unlock and get off, but that is probably the way I put it on.
customer_reviews.author: ThinkJoy

customer_reviews.title: Once it clicks in...it’s a charm
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes have a difficult time getting it into ‘start position but other than that momentary hassle ...it’s a big hel p in the kitchen!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty and new!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old food processor that was not in use, and had quit working, so when I found a good deal for this smaller one, I went ahead and bought it. So far I've been very happy with it! It's not too large but still holds the amounts I need for food prep for one or two people with no trouble. This model is not fancy, but it gets the job done and can handle everything I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: C Hale

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love my food processor. This has made gardening harvest so much easier. Canning just got so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: What a time saver!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic! I get a lot of use out of this product. Not really great for slicing because you have to cut it in pretty small sections to get it to fit down the tube but for most other things it's great.
customer_reviews.author: jowest

customer_reviews.title: Like it but not as good as my old cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: It's a good processor, don't get me wrong! It just doesn't seem as substantial as my old Cuisinart (which lasted nearly 15 years before giving up the ghost). Will be testing it with making hummus...will update a review with how well it does with a thicker mixture. Feb 26 2014 update: Ok it did just fine with the hummus recipe - so it is stronger than it looks! Nice processor.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Prentice

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for my needs. It is well made, sturdy and works exactly like it should. Would give this as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Carla C

customer_reviews.title: Bought for work and so far is the best food processor I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: Bought for work and so far is the best food processor I’ve ever had! It’s quieter than the other models I’ve used and very easy to disassemble, wash, and put back together again. Also way cheaper than the other brands for the size!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Compact. Doesn't take up a lot of space in your counter!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Babb

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I used for first time today! Was able ro remove top with ease. I needed this type because I have severe arthritis and not able to use thumbs as normally would. The processor itself is marvelous. I have used a few times and not disappointed with any part of it! What a great deal!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for the price. Allows me to make double portions of recipes because of the size!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. It's meant for doing large jobs so if you only are going to use it for small batches you may want to think about a smaller model. I've been using this for about 3 years now and it preforms just as it did the day I opened it out of the box. Solid little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so long ago and it still in good conditions. I think I bought like 10 years ago, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Isis Morales

customer_reviews.title: Parts break off if you look at them funny. Loud
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. Flimsy, cheap plastic, leaks with even the tiniest amount of liquid, well below the fill line. Parts break off if you look at them funny. Loud, irritating motor underperforms.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Just big enough to make Humus
customer_reviews.text: This is actually bigger than t seems. I was able to make Humus with one large tin of Chick peas and all the ingredients without it overflowing. Perfectly fits in the space I have for it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Amoury

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this 2 months and it has completely stopped working. It’s a piece of garbage. It doesn’t shred anything correctly. Definitely spend a few more dollars and get something that is actually going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Blake

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I like this processor, it can chop up a good amount of food, maybe not for a large family, but more than enough for the 2 of us in my household. It does tend to chop things a bit fine. Overall, I enjoy it. Oh, the plastic cover is a little breakable. Someone dropped ours and it cracked, but supergluing it together did the trick and still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Used twice and done
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone. I only used it twice and it stopped working. I called Hamilton Beach for troubleshooting and they offered to ship me a new one - but I have to pay $14.95 to ship the broken one back. Not worth it to me, I risk getting the same low quality product and doing this all over again. BAD PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: A great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've made a habit of reading reviews before purchasing products. Every good review about this food processor was absolutely true. I love, love it! I haven't found anything I don't like about it yet and would recommend it to anyone. It's so easy to use and clean up is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: browneyedgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for simple tasks (and the fact I didn't have a ton of money to spend). I have started online cooking classes and needed a food processor for certain recipes. Hamilton Beach stepped up to plate and delivered. I have used it to grate and shred cheese, grind nuts and seeds, and make salsas. It did it all effortlessly. I only gave it four stars because it is still just a 30 dollar machine and I am sure it is limited as compared to the more expensive models, but if you need basic food processing (minus the expense) then this is your machine. It also cleans very easily without a hundred separate pieces to dismantle and wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Grey

customer_reviews.title: This baby is a workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: This baby is a workhorse. There is a newer version but I like this one because it has a much lower profile that the newer one. If you are short on storage or counter space this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Niesioa

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach 70450 8-Cup Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: Works Well. My wife likes it. Uses it to make Hummus.
customer_reviews.author: Gpcharlie

customer_reviews.title: Basic, No-Frills Blender
customer_reviews.text: It's alright. Inexpensive. Does leak fluid when trying to blend something runny. On a positive side, it is compact, relatively quite in operation & easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Good Device, Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It works well, and has a large enough capacity that I'm not stopping to empty it while I'm trying to shred/chop/slice. It's easy to clean and fairly easy to use. It's not very forgiving about letting it run whilst reloading the chute. I have learned how much I dislike potato bits on the ceiling. They usually fall off when you least expect it.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Winters

customer_reviews.title: its replaced the one I have its great have the same one
customer_reviews.text: its replaced the one I have its great have the same one before
customer_reviews.author: louella lanier

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value
customer_reviews.text: Wow I thought I'd have to spend > $100 for a decent food processor but this HB delivers all the performance I need for just $26 with free Prime shipping. Highly recommended, I use it to make cauliflower pizza crust among other things. Easy to pop in dishwasher too, compact attractive design as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Works great but you can't do bread dough in it...
customer_reviews.text: The lack of doing bread dough was not in the description on line...or I didn't see it. Fortunately, I read the directions. However, I can still do pie dough...or I hope I can! No mention of that! It's extremely easy to use and store. For the price, I would definitely give this product a kudo or two and tell my friends about it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Small and functional device that I do use
customer_reviews.text: I do use this food processor in everyday cooking for chopping, cutting and grating vegetables, and it does it very well. Since it is not big, it does not take much space and it is easy to clean. It does not just seat on the counter like a lot of big food processors do (since you don't want to use it unless you do something really big) - I do use it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: byslava

customer_reviews.title: Surprise :)
customer_reviews.text: Looks weird but shape n design works better than all others !!!
customer_reviews.author: drmoore

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product. Luckily for me
customer_reviews.text: I used it once to make pesto and then didn't try to use it until 3 months later, at which point I found it dead. Not a good product. Luckily for me, amazon has great customer service and refunded the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Morghan Reid

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: The processor works well so far. We have used it a few times and we are pleased with the way it works. It is a nice size to store. It sets up easy and quickly. The working parts clean up well in the top shelf of the dishwasher. We were looking for a machine like this and we are pleased to have found this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Orval Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The drive mechanism broke the second time we used it. Very frustrating, especially when you need it! I recommend that you avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stoner

customer_reviews.title: dooper
customer_reviews.text: Super dooper equipment. It does everything a bigger size one does and is much less trouble to clean up. I use it on a regular basis and it handles any size batch I need for normal recipes. I am very pleased and would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: WJ Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this food processor! It's heavy, not cheaply made. It's a workhorse!
customer_reviews.author: Granny Sweets

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Compact 8-Cup Food Processor & Vegetable Chopper for Chopping, Shredding, Slicing, Mixing and Mincing, White (70450)
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe Hamilton Beach 8 cup food Processor is a counter top time-saver that's Compact in size but big on features. A reversible disc and chopping blade let you prepare a wide variety of foods. All removable parts are dishwasher safe parts, so cleanup is easy.
feature_bullets: Included Components: Hamilton Beach 70450 8-Cup Food Processor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars928 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
